sentence.Network_en: She picked up the gauntlet in her incisive Keynote Address to the Conference.
sentence.Network_cn: 在大会主题发言中，她言辞犀利地回应挑战。

sentence.Network_en: They have thrown down the gauntlet to the PM by demanding a referendum.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们向首相挑战,要求进行公民投票.

sentence.Network_en: He was not one to retreat but rather one who would take up the gauntlet.
sentence.Network_cn: 他不是一个想退却的人,倒是一个宁愿应战的人.

phrase.cizu_name: take up (或 throw down) the gauntlet

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French gantelet, diminutive of gant 'glove', of Germanic origin
mid 17th cent.: alteration of gantlope (from Swedish gatlopp, from gata 'lane' + lopp 'course') by association with gauntlet

entry.def: Gauntlets are long, thick, protective gloves.

example.ex: ...a pair of black leather driving gauntlets.
example.tran: 一副驾驶用黑色皮手套

entry.def: If you pick up the gauntlet or take up the gauntlet, you accept the challenge that someone has made.

example.ex: She picked up the gauntlet in her incisive Keynote Address to the Conference...
example.tran: 在大会主题发言中，她言辞犀利地回应挑战。

example.ex: Whoever decides to take up the gauntlet and challenge the Prime Minister will have a tough battle.
example.tran: 谁要是接受挑战，向首相叫板，都将经历一场鏖战。

entry.tran: 受到严厉批评；受到猛烈攻击
entry.def: If you run the gauntlet, you go through an unpleasant experience in which a lot of people criticize or attack you.

example.ex: The trucks tried to drive to the British base, running the gauntlet of marauding bands of gunmen.
example.tran: 卡车队试图冲过几帮劫匪的火力网开赴英军基地。

entry.def: If you throw down the gauntlet to someone, you say or do something that challenges them to argue or compete with you.

example.ex: Luxury car firm Jaguar has thrown down the gauntlet to competitors by giving the best guarantee on the market.
example.tran: 豪华轿车生产商捷豹公司推出了市场上最诱人的保修服务，向竞争对手发出了挑战。

means.word_mean: 1. to offer or accept a challenge;
2. a glove of armored leather; protects the hand
4. a form of punishment in which a person is forced to run between two lines of men facing each other and armed with clubs or whips to beat the victim

auth_sentence.content: With his mailed gauntlet he brushed away a furtive tear.
auth_sentence.res_content: With his mailed gauntlet he brushed away a furtive tear.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: With his mailed gauntlet he brushed away a furtive tear.

auth_sentence.content: You've thrown down the gauntlet which I readily accept.
auth_sentence.res_content: You've thrown down the gauntlet which I readily accept.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You've thrown down the gauntlet which I readily accept.

auth_sentence.content: What we got was the gauntlet of demagoguery.
auth_sentence.res_content: What we got was the gauntlet of demagoguery.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: What we got was the gauntlet of demagoguery.
